definitions.definition: the direction in which the sun goes down in the evening, opposite to the east, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction:
examples: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.
There has been concern in/throughout the West about the effects of this measure.

definitions.definition: In the US, the West is the part of the country west of the Mississippi river that only became developed in the late 1800s:
to or in the west of the US:
examples: Travis moved out west after college.

definitions.definition: in or forming the west part of something:
a wind coming from the west

examples: Go due (= directly) west until you see a lake.
